Went for brunch yesterday. Took some friends from out of town. The food here used to be interesting and good and it has gone seriously downhill. We went around 12:30 after there being a 45 minute wait a couple doors down at Moo&Brew.
There were only two seated tables in the restaurant and one person working both the bar and floor. I guess that is telling of how business is going, unfortunately. The server was kind but not very knowledgeable. They were also out of a few things.

I ordered a house salad with steak and it was so gross. The steak was chewy and thin and the salad looked was very watery and full of chopped red onions and big chunks of carrots. I was seriously beyond disappointed. The kids flat bread pizza was gross. You know if a kid won't eat bread with cheese on it, something is wrong.

Apparently the burgers were pretty good, but the Parmesan Fries were lackluster.
Doubt we will return

This place is a perfect fit for those looking for a more laid back place in the Plaza Midwood area. I came here on a Monday night and there was a pretty good cross for it being a weekday.

The interior is decorated nicely and featured artwork from local artists for sale. It gave the place a nice vibe that I liked. The servers were friendly and were attentive. 

For beer I got a pale ale that was on draft. It was crisp and had a slight fruity flavor. For food I got the Korean burger with parm fries. The burger was juicy and had a nice spice thanks to the sauce. The burger was topped with pork belly which was a tasty addition. The fries were crispy and had just enough cheese. 

Overall this was a great place to grab a drink and dinner!

Awesome bartenders that really know their stuff! I've only came here twice but those two times were a great experience. They mix up these concoctions and it's almost like its personalized for you. Just tell them what you like as a liquor base and they can pretty much take it from there. They have a nice outside area that has a foosball table and some picnic benches. They are also dog friendly, at least in the outside area from what I can see. I recommend this place to anyone looking for some quality adult beverages.

I sampled their food at Yelp's Freaky at the Factory event. Going off that, I look forward to visiting the restaurant.  The chicken-wrapped bacon was delicious, and the fried avocados are something I will certainly order.
Very good service! Our bartender was awesome and very attentive (forgot his name but sleeves on his arms!) Very laid back comfortable environment! Will definitely be back!
I love Pint Central! Great selection of beer and the food is so good! The patio is my favorite place to chill!

I really want to like this place because I live down the street and the convenience is super ideal. I've been here twice now, so hoping third times the charm?

We went in today for a beer because their patio is adorable and great and it was a super great patio day. While the patio is great, table service on the patio was unfortunately non existent, so we went to the bar outside (also a great idea and convenient) but the bartenders didn't even check on the outside bar. So we then went inside to the bar, and it took three movements down the bar for someone to notice us. Finally, when they did notice us (yay!) it took several more minutes (it felt like eons but really, what doesn't when you're waiting to drink your beer in the sunshine) for them to bring the beers and run my card. I know they're new and have some kinks to work out, and it really pains me to complain about service, but it was disappointing (at least everyone was nice!).

We also were there for one of their soft openings, and while everyone was friendly then too, service was slow that night as well (which is understandable kinks and all and it was really busy). We tasted some of the food and it was ok, but nothing out of this world. The music was also super loud (god I feel like a grandmother for saying that) and the atmosphere I guess just wasn't for me.

The beer selection is good (but on par and similar to many other places in the area that I love...hello Kickstand!!!) and the patio is nice so I'll probably give them another chance, but might wait a few weeks for those kinks.

This place is not bad to grab a quick drink and some appetizers.  It gets really busy depending on the night, and I know they offer trivia sometimes.  They have good deals throughout the week.  10% off on Saturdays when you bring your dog-how cool is that?!  They have an indoor and outdoor space, which of course is great and gives us different options.  

The service is quick.  The apps a delish-try the eggrolls (yum) and the people are pretty darn friendly.  Overall, not exactly a date spot, but fun bar scene and plenty of room.

I was eager to check out pint central's food and bar scene, and my expectations were mostly met. Beer selection is on point - bartender recommended the weyerbacher imperial stout which was well balanced. I will add this one to my favorites. 

Parking situation is kind of a nightmare. I don't think pint central has more than ten spots to its name, which leaves everyone else to scramble to find street parking or park in the gravel lot across the street next to thirsty beaver. This necessitates a dash across busy central avenue after, which I was not a fan of. 

Food situation was ok. I was honestly expecting better based on what I had heard, but it was solid given most come here for a drink with food as an afterthought. Mozzarella bites were tasty but over breaded in my opinion. Red peppers were a nice touch though. I had the churrasco which turned out to be very thin slices (almost gyro style) pieces of meat accompanied by fries. The meat had plenty of flavor but I was underwhelmed by the portion size, and it seemed as though the same meat was used in the steak sandwich my friend ordered at a portion of the price. 

Overall I had a good time, but given parking and food, I won't be adding this one to my regular rotation.

I've been wanting to try pint central for a long time and we finally made it in. We had a group of 8 and got a table in the back for food and drinks.  The beer list is very extensive and the menu is packed with goodies. The waitstaff is very friendly and helpful but we did had some issues getting the food out all at once. I had the shrimp tacos that weren't my favorite. 
With all that said, I wasn't going to give PC a five star review.... but! The reason I am is because of the owner. After seeing my post of the picture of the shrimp tacos and my comment, he came over to the table to talk to me personally and apologized for the tacos and the service.  For this, I will give PC 5 stars and return again! Businesses that are willing to learn and grow from mistakes are the best places to frequent!

I really never write reviews, but this group deserves it.  I had a great experience there before, and then my wife and I went and had a wonderful meal together.  The food is really, really good and they have many healthy options. The drink menu helps as well, but it is really nice to have this group in the neighborhood!

If I could give half stars, I would give this place 3.5 stars. The best part of the trip to me was the beer list. There were tons of draft options (and they are on special on Wednesday, so be sure to go then). I had Windy Hill Gala Peach and really liked it. I didn't love that the water came out at room temperature with no ice, but our waitress brought us some when we asked. 

I really liked the taste of the sliders, although I wish the patty had been bigger because the bun overpowered it. The taste of the garlic curly fries was good but the fries weren't really curly. They were more of a curved shoestring. All in all, the taste of the food was good but I wish it had been executed better.
Great tapas, great sandwiches, great beer, great art, what more do you want? Stop in on Thursday night for half of tapas. The Korean burger is great!

I like this place. I ordered a couple of craft beers. I had Argentinian style beef empanadas and they were really good. They have eggs and raisins which it's a nice touch (not the egg, but it's not overbearing) I pair it with cilantro-avocado aioli (they charge extra) because it doesn't come with a dipping sauce. For the main entree I had the Churrasco with fries as my side, they were really good too. They put Parmesan cheese on them. I ordered it medium rare but it came out medium well. Can't expect it to be perfect because it's not a steak house but it was flavorful. The bartender was nice. They didn't have a lot of people when I was there but they got a few orders to go. Overall this place is a good place to check out.

The food and the beers offered (on tap and in bottles/cans) are AMAZING. I almost cannot come without getting the avocado fries. The cauliflower bites, jalape√±o chicken poppers, mini burgers, and garlic Parmesan fries are just a few awesome tapas. The turkey sandwich and breakfast burger are delicious. And the entrees are even better! $1 tacos on Mondays I think are still a thing and I could eat a million they're so good. Love it!

The drink selection here can't be beat. They have something for everyone and can make good recommendations. The food is also delicious. We got the cauliflower bites, chicken sliders, beef sliders, avocado egg rolls, chicken poppers, and Brussels sprouts. Everything was delicious. The avocado egg rolls and beef sliders were my favorites. While the cauliflower bites were good, the bigger pieces did not get cooked all the way and still had uncooked batter in them. I will definitely be coming back!

I had to update my review on this place because wow how things have changed in the year that I was gone! Trivia night ok awesome should have a good crowd. We decided to stop in for a few beers not the trivia as I was in the office late.

Bartenders could not be more apathetic in this place. After standing politely at the bar (which was full with trivia players, but not customers asking for drinks) for over five minutes, I had to waive down a bartender. I'm not standing here for fun, I'm standing here waiting to be acknowledged. Asked for a beer list to which the bartender obliged, but had to go find one (another two minutes of waiting) then instead of letting me quickly read over it he disappeared again. The whole process of ordering a beer when no one else was waiting was literally a 10 minute ordeal. Then to make matters worse, prices have gone up here so I paid $7 for a beer I could get for $4.50 next door at Moo and Brew. Don't get me wrong I wouldn't mind paying a bit more for the same beer if the ambiance and service matched the up charge, but it didn't. The bartender was unenthused handling me the beer and when I said 'thank you' didn't even bother to respond.

But wait...there is more. Went out to the patio for a more quiet atmosphere the waitress stops by after a few shots of tequila to ask if we wanted anything else. I asked if she could bring another beer list and she responds that she is going to change a few of the kegs quickly and will be right back. Ok....two thoughts on this: 1.) bring me a list now, so I can look over it while you are changing the kegs 2.) this was an opportunity for you to sell me a beer already on tap while you changed kegs and lines and then sell me a second one based on saying its a freshly tapped keg. Needless to say the girl never came back with a beer list or my friends tequila shot. 

Also, note to management your staff lost the tab and instead of trying to clear the air they walked around asking each other frantically what we had to drink. Why not just approach us, fess up to the mistake (they happen, no big deal), and ask us what we had. Instead they put together a bill that was completely inaccurate. 

I heard through the grapevine that this place has new ownership (may or may not be true), but my advice would be to have a staff training ASAP. There are way too many bars in Charlotte with staff who at least act like they want to be there and value you as a customer for me to frequent an establishment where clearly I was not valued as a customer or a human being for that matter.

I want to love this place with all my heart BUT!!!! they will not let me if they are not out of one thing it's another no food this week last week no liquor the people are great but they can only do so much with what they have and it's basically nothing and on a Saturday night no less

I don't often write reviews of Yelp, but I felt I needed to for Pint Central. The interior is warm and inviting with many, but not an overbearing, number of televisions. The staff was friendly and quick to get our beer order from the great selection of craft beers on tap. The menu seemed to have some great selections at a good price, but this is where the praise ends.

I ordered the Choripan, an Argentinian sausage sandwich with chimichurri sauce. On the side, sweet potato fries. My fiance had a grilled turkey sandwich, and her brother, the breakfast burger. We also had a couple of apps.

Our food arrived quickly and hot, the sweet potato fries were delicious. My fiance really liked her turkey sandwich. Everything else we received was salted so incredibly heavily I almost couldn't finish eating it, and I'm not one to waste food. If they cut the salt back by about 40-60% and the seasoning on their garlic fries back just a touch, it would have been a much better experience. I can't say I'd go back, unless just for some beers, because the food was just far too salty and I'm not a picky eater.

Perfect for a quick beer and eats on a weeknight. 

We are in town for a long business trip and our air b&b hosts suggested this for late night beer and light dinner.

Monday night was $1 tacos and $3 Latin beer.

The avocado egg-roll was good. We had veg, chicken and beef tacos. Great for quick eats! 

Lots of tv's for the game or whatever you can't tear yourself away from.

Parking is horrible. We had to park at the family dollar lot and walk (just a block).

Nice bar tenders.

Excited to try this new place in my neighborhood.  Entering Pint Central, we expected for it to be more crowded on a Friday night, but that was not the case.  Good for me, because I don't like crowds.  The interior was open and decorated in a minimalist style.  We told the hostess, "2" when she asked us how many.  She responded, "are you sure?" which I found a bit odd.  I don't think that she  meant to say that.
We ordered the mozzarella bites, avocado fries, calamari and Brussels sprouts.  The first three were typical fried bar food, but those Brussels sprouts were something special.  They were chargrilled and tossed with pesto.  How brave of them to put Brussels sprouts on their menu.  And how delicious they were!  My next favorite were the mozzarella bites.  We could have used a few more of them.  The avocado fries needed more flavor, and the calamari was a bit on the rubbery side.
I would like to try more items from their menu, especially the beet panini.  And, I am definitely going back for more Brussels sprouts!

This place has a super chill vibe. With it's fairy lights and outside patio, it evokes sweet summer memories complemented by the excellent variety of drinks. The restrooms are surprisingly clean and well lit - not what I was expecting given the rest of the decor, but it proved to be a very pleasant discovery. As the night progresses, it teeters slightly off it's cool throwback vibe pedestal into a dark grungy alleyway abyss, but if you leave on time, it's all good.

I live nearby, but didn't try it out for a long time. Note it is my go to lunch spot. Good specials. ($7 sandwiches for lunch weekdays). Discount drafts on Wednesday. 
Great food and beer. 
I score on quality, price, and atmosphere.
Maybe a 4 everyday, and a five on Wednesdays

Been here twice now. Michael is a great bartender... The garlic park fries are out of this world! Never liked them before... Most of the crowd is laid back, a few get too pretentious... Full of themselves, but the staff is not that way... Look, go check it out.

I have been here twice, once for dinner on a Sunday night and once on a late Saturday night and both times were great! 

Bar atmosphere review: The indoor area has lots of seating and a long bar. The outdoor back patio area is also pretty neat- check that out if the weather is nice. They are also dog friendly. The dinner crowd were 20-somethings, trendy, slightly hipster and not too loud. The night scene is louder and gets more crowded but the wait time for drinks isn't too long in my experience

Food review: The chicken poppers were good, not spicy at all, slightly overpriced for 4 poppers. The breakfast burger is big, if you're not starving you could get an app, split the burger and that could be a decent meal for two girls. It didn't blow me away like other "breakfast-style" burgers I've had in the past, but it tasted good. The buffalo wings at the bar are SPICY! I enjoy spicy food, and usually don't even find buffalo wings that hot, but these are red-hot! If you're into that, you'll love these but if you just like a normal buffalo wing these may be too much unless you drown them in ranch/bleu cheese. Good wings though, lots of meat on the bone and not much fat.
$2 mimosas on Sundays!! Avocado fries and beet sandwich are delish, patio is perfect on a sunny day and there's even a little window so you can be at the bar and still be outside
Food is amazing!!! Avocado egg rolls are my favorite!! I love the beer list and the drink specials. I like that they have outdoor seating so you can bring your dogs.

This review is based solely on one specific experience. I should preface that by saying that this is a place I come to for dinner at least once every month or two. 

I love lots of things about Pint Central but the experience we had tonight just plain sucked. The restaurant was not crowded (maybe 1/3 full, max) but service was extremely, extremely slow. No apologies or explanation when it took several minutes from when we sat down till we first saw our server (that's fine, it happens) and no apologies or explanation when it took 35+ minutes to get our food (basic sandwiches from the menu, nothing tricky whatsoever). We didn't see our server at all between ordering the food and then getting it 35+ minutes later. That part is not cool - I definitely would have liked to have our presence/status of the food/drink refills at least recognized. Once the meals finally came, the server asked if we'd like any sauces on the side and recommended a horseradish aioli among other things. We agreed to try that and a couple others. When the bill came, each sauce had a $.50 up charge. That is fine to charge for sauces - but not cool to not tell us up front! The whole experience was just super disappointing. I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because the food was mostly fine when it did come out. I will say that about half of the roasted potatoes were undercooked but by that point I was so hungry that I didn't really care. 

Will I go back? Maybe. I love supporting local places in the neighborhood, but Pint Central needs to up their game if they want to build/keep loyal customers.

Pint Central is a hidden gem in Charlotte. I went on Saturday night for a birthday dinner; we were with a pretty big group (around 15) and the group leader called ahead. Pint Central had a table set up for us when we arrived, which was really awesome! 

When you walk in, you're in a big open space with a long bar on the right. It's got a clean feel, not real divey like some of the other spots in Plaza. They also have an outdoor area in the back, but it was too cold to be out there.

Pint Central does have a lot of beers on tap, but not as many as you may think given the name. We came for a late dinner, so I ate some snack at home beforehand because I was so hungry. I ended up order a small plate - the caprese - as my meal. It was DELICIOUS. It was sliced avocado topped with tomatoes, basil, their homemade mozzarella, and a balsamic glaze (see photo). The burgers looked delicious. I tried my fiance's parmesan fries... OH MY GOSH. They were so good. 

The only reason I rate Pint Central 4 stars instead of 5 is because it took a really long time to get our checks. Now, I do recognize that were in a big group, there was a groupon, there were multiple separate checks and some couples paying together --- a lot going on. It just seemed a little too long, even given the circumstance. Other than that, our service was great throughout the dining experience.

ANYWAY, I will definitely be back to Pint Central and I highly recommend it to others. Yum!

I'm absolutely a fan of this little joint!  Several beers on tap in regular rotation.  Local and beyond.  The food is pretty on point for a place more known as a drinking spot.  Wings, yucca fries, beef sliders, chicken sliders, beef tips, and more.  They have an outdoor patio outback and some covered seating out front.  They offer half price small plate apps before 7pm on Thursdays, which is an incredible deal, and they have regular beer specials.  The servers are usually friendly, though at times a little slow.  Parking would be the only downside, as the lot offers, give or take, 15 spaces shared between 3 businesses.  You typically have to fight for parking on the adjacent street, but it's not too bad.

One of my go to places in plaza! Great vibes, food and trivia! (Come early on Tuesdays, trivia night gets pretty crowded)

The beer and avocado fries are on point!

I got a taste of Argentina and it tastes as great as it looks. The Empanadas and the Chroipan are a must try. I preferred the beef over the chicken empanadas but can't go wrong either way. The pork belly is addictive with each light but flavorful bite!

This is. Pretty awesome ace to go in plaza midwood. Don't get me started on the beer and drinks. Let's talk about how they make fresh mozzarella here daily. Yes. Along with everything thing else they make in house. This is a foodies dream. For apps the mini burgers are going to melt in your mouth. Seriously no need to chew this one, or all 3. I mean it has candied bacon jam on them them. The pork belly is also heavy served with kimichi. Also homemade. Avocado fries, I don't know how they get them to be just like potato fries but these things pack some flavor and crisp! You also don't feel so bad because it's avocado :) roasted Brussels sprouts are not bad either, and I am not a fan of Brussel sprouts. So anyone that can get me to eat them is a plus in my book. The best thing a foodie can do is go with a friend or more and just order the menu and all share. Because everything here is good.

Decided to check out this place for some lunch and some drinks. Met the owner/chef while sitting at the bar with a friend, friendly guy from Argentina. We started off with some liquor drinks and I went for their 5$ Jameson special. For lunch my friend and I shared the mushroom goat chases bruschetta which was amazing and a must get if you like mushrooms. We split the steak sandwich and avocado egg rolls for the rest of our lunch and enjoyed those as well. A chill environment during the day time when we were there. Not sure about nights or game days though. Will be back for sure.

I am not one to leave a bad review because I work in the service industry, but when you go to a restaurant twice and have horrible service twice by the same girl. That's horrible. She brought out two of my friends check. And took forever on our food and drinks. Definitely won't be coming back.

We paid with a Groupon which was an awesome deal! Well worth it. They open at 11, we arrived at 11:45 and it was dead. We discovered the back outdoor enclosed patio. Overall the server was the best! She had such a fun personality and her suggestions were sincere. She made our visit fun and the food was Bomb! I mean we were very impressed with our service and are soo eager to return to try more of the menu. We have the house sausage sandwich and Korean burger. Freakinggg amazing unique flavors you won't find anything like it! And of course the beer was the last straw. This Groupon deal was the best one yet!

The food here is OUT OF THIS WORLD! The chicken sliders are my favorite along with the BLT salad. I really wish they would sell the basil aioli dressing by the bottle. I would put it on EVERYTHING! The staff is always really friendly when I go there, I even held a Christmas party here! Love it

Every couple of months I wonder why I don't go here more often, so I go. Then I'm SLOWLY reminded why I don't. The service is the worst! While I understand that on a holiday weekend things get crazy (Memorial Day weekend) we were 2 of 8 people in the entire place. While the one guy behind the bar proceeded to talk with 2 of the customers for 10 minutes he lost out on the 9th and 10th customers of the night. I had a few more minutes of patience in me. Finally ordered a couple of drinks, the crowd turned to 6. Finally ordered food the crowd turned to 2. Food was good (saving grace). All that being said if in a couple of months I wonder why I haven't been hopefully I read this and go somewhere else.
